case_title: Assistant Commissioner, SRB, Karachi vs Messrs Mohsin Mehmood (Manzoor Ahmad)

accussed_details.name: Messrs Mohsin Mehmood
allegation: Non-payment of Sindh Sales Tax amounting to Rs.74,683,912
Violation of Sections 3, 8, 9, 17, and 30 of Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011

complaint_summary: The appellant alleged that the respondent failed to pay Sindh Sales Tax on services provided to Dow University of Health Sciences during the tax periods July 2015 to June 2016, amounting to Rs.74,683,912.
investigation_summary: The Sindh Revenue Board (SRB) issued a show-cause notice to the respondent for non-payment of Sindh Sales Tax and imposed penalties. The respondent argued that the services provided were exempt under relevant notifications as they pertained to government buildings not meant for commercial purposes.
judgment_summary: The Appellate Tribunal Inland Revenue remanded the case to the Assessing Officer for fresh assessment. It held that the Dow University is a statutory autonomous body and not a government entity, thus not entitled to exemptions under the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011. Both the original and appellate orders were set aside due to legal infirmities.
punishment: Case remanded for fresh assessment; previous penalty of Rs.3,734,196 and tax liability of Rs.74,683,912 set aside.
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded to the Assessing Officer for fresh assessment.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued that Dow University is an autonomous body and not entitled to exemptions.
Defense argued that services provided were exempt under SRB Notifications dated 18.06.2013 and 26.08.2011.
assets: Revenue of Rs.533,456,514 earned by respondent from Dow University
statutes: Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
Dow University of Health Sciences Act, 2004
sections: Sections 3, 8, 9, 17, 30, 43, and 44 of Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
key_issues: Whether services provided fall under Tariff Heading 9809.0000 or 9824.0000.
Whether Dow University qualifies as a government entity for tax exemption.

maxims.Strict Interpretation of Exemption: Exemption provisions must be strictly construed against the taxpayer and in favor of taxing authority.

legal_terms.Tariff Heading: Classification of taxable services under Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011.
legal_terms.Default Surcharge: Additional charge imposed for delayed payment of tax.

words_and_phrases.Body Corporate: An entity with legal rights and obligations distinct from its members.
words_and_phrases.Government Entity: An organization directly controlled and managed by the government.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves tax exemption claims by a contractor for services provided to Dow University, which was argued to be a government entity. The tribunal remanded the case for reassessment, rejecting the exemption claims based on the autonomous status of Dow University.

appellant.position: Dow University is not a government entity.

respondent.position: Dow University is a government entity.

findings.dow_university_status: Statutory and autonomous body, not a government entity.
findings.exemption_notifications: Not applicable for the tax periods in question.

decision.case_remanded: To Assessing Officer for fresh assessment.
